page.title: 11RELIGION
page.content: There is one church in each of the two villages. All Saints at Hougham and St. Mary's at Marston. They are both Church of England. The churches normally hold wervices on alternate Sundays. At the moment they are without pastoral representation since the death of the rector. The regular churchgoers number about 5. Flowers are arranged in the churches by a small group of ladies in the villages, not necessarily church going members. A few villagers attend the Parish Church in Grantham. Recently there have been a few burglaries at local churches and objects of antiquity have been stolen.
